description_cie: Providing data science capabilities to help NGOs and international cooperation agencies build their programmes and measure their impact
description_job: Masae Analytics is a fast-growing start-up company providing consulting services based on data analytics. We develop innovative methodologies leveraging a wide array of technologies such as remote sensing and satellite imagery processing, geo-mapping, web development, econometrics, machine learning, big data processing, etc. We apply those skills to topics as diverse as climate change monitoring, post-conflict damage assessments, telecom and energy planning, geopolitics, foreign-influence and disinformation detection, geo-marketing, digital divide and mobile financial services. Together with our sister company Altai Consulting (www.altaiconsulting.com), Masae Analytics works for both public sector (the United Nations, the World Bank, the GSMA, etc.) and corporate actors (retailers, mobile network operators**, satellite operators,**etc.) in Europe and (mainly) in emerging markets, particularly Africa and the Middle-East. We are currently expanding our team of Data Scientists, and are looking for candidates eager to meet challenges and discover new culture and environments. For further information please visit our website: www.masae-analytics.com Job description Key aspects of the Data Scientist mission will be to: - Understand clientsâ€™ needs - Conduct statistical and business analytics - Design and implement new approaches to answer clientsâ€™ needs - Produce analytical reports and presentations - Contribute to the development and optimization of Masaeâ€™s tools and processes Salary: 1400â‚¬/month  General requirements: - Curiosity, flexibility, attention to details and strong work ethics - Sensitivity to data security and confidentiality - Eagerness to travel and to discover new cultures & environments - Interest in international development/cooperation issues Technical requirements: - Knowledge of Python Data Science environments (IPython/Jupyter Notebook, Pandas, Numpy, Scikit-learn, etc.) Nice to have: - Knowledge of SQL and of its open-source implementations (Postgres, MySQL, SQLite) - Knowledge of geographic analysis tools (PostGIS, QGIS) and of its Python libraries - Knowledge of Natural Language Processing tools and Python libraries - Knowledge of NoSQL (MongoDB) or Hadoop / Apache Spark or tools like Splunk or Elastic Search - Comfortable with big data manipulation and parallel computing - Knowledge of Unix shell (OS X / Linux) - Basic knowledge of web languages/frameworks (JavaScript, HTML, CSS, etc., Python web frameworks like Django, Flask)

description_cie: ACCâ€™s mission is to accelerate the transition to sustainable and affordable mobility for all, significantly reducing greenhouse gas emissions through producing batteries in Europe.
description_job: Join us and be a pioneer for a green transport revolution.Automotive Cells Company (ACC) is one of Europeâ€™s newest and most exciting high-tech companies.Â Backed byÂ Saft-Total, Stellantis and Mercedes-Benz,Â ACC is set toÂ power the futureÂ of the automotive industryÂ by innovating in battery technology.Â We aim to produce sustainable, affordable, high-capacity, longer-life batteries as aÂ cleanerÂ alternative to current energy sources. We have created an R&DÂ centerÂ and new state-of-the art facilityÂ in Nouvelle Aquitaine, France, and we are building gigafactories in Germany and Italy, in addition to the one already built in Hauts de France.We need a range ofÂ skilled and agile peopleÂ to bring our vision to life,Â especially in the areas ofÂ industrialization, mechanical design, testing/prototyping and any other function of a new-bornÂ company. If youâ€™re looking to take your career further than you imagined, if youâ€™re passionateÂ about creating cleaner transport, weâ€™d like to hear from you.Our core Values are : Pioneering Spirit, Fast & Agile, Excellence, Greener & Cleaner !We are also very proud of our 2022 CSR Report : https://www.acc-emotion.com/stories/accs-2022-corporate-sustainability-reportAccelerating sustainable mobility for all.Overall job definition :The HR Data Analyst will play a pivotal role in collecting, analyzing, and interpreting HR data to drive strategic decision-making and support HR initiatives. Use data analysis to improve HR practices, enhance employee experiences, and contribute to the organization's overall success.Main missions :Data Governance :Â· Gather, organize, and maintain HR data from various sources to ensure accuracy and completeness.Â· Establish robust data management practices and procedures.Â· Ensure HR data handling complies with data protection regulations.Â· Safeguard the confidentiality and security of sensitive HR data.Â· Ensure Bridge with data department.Data Analytics :Â· Analyze HR data to extract valuable insights and trends.Â· Generate regular and ad-hoc reports, visualizations, and dashboards to aid decision-making.Â· Develop and monitor key HR metrics and KPIs to assess the effectiveness of HR processes.Â· Contribute to the development of data-driven strategies to improve HR outcomes.Â· Provide actionable insights derived from data analysis to support HR initiatives.Â· Collaborate with HR teams to make data-informed decisions that enhance HRProcess Improvement:Â· Identify opportunities to streamline HR data processes and enhance data quality.Â· Collaborate with HR teams to implement process improvements, automation and increase efficiency.Â· Provide training and support to HR staff on data-related tools and best practices.Â· Share knowledge and insights with colleagues to promote a data-driven HR culture. Knowledge :- Data Analysis Skills- HR Knowledge- Data Management- Project Management- Visualization and Reporting/Experience :At least 2 years (apprentices included)Qualifications:Master of Science in Human Resource Management. Master of Science in Data Science or Analytics. Master of Science in Industrial-Organizational Psychology. French, EnglishKey behaviours :- Critical Thinking - Communication Skills- Attention to Detail- Continuous Learning- Teamwork agility and proactive.Some extra skills which make the difference :PowerBI, SAP SuccessFactors, Experience in IndustryWhy join us?Our Advantages and Perks: new premises, parking spaces reserved for carpoolers, possibility of recharging your electric car on reserved spaces in our parking lot.Other perks and advantages include : Company restaurant, meal and also vegetables/fruits baskets delivery service. Janitorial services, telecommuting, complementary retirement plan (subject to a salary threshold), additionnal & seniority leaves, well-being workshops, osteopathy sessions.You will also benefit from access to our Sports & Culture association, conferences, and also sports, holidays and culture subsidy.https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NbXdlWjWhX8https://www.acc-emotion.com/fr/facilities/bruges-bordeauxOur process usually involves 3 interviews: 2 technical and one HR.

description_cie: Dioxycle develops breakthrough technology to produce everyday fuels and chemicals from CO2 shifting from a fossil-based economy to a circular CO2-based economy.
description_job: About Dioxycle Dioxycle is pioneering breakthrough carbon utilization technologies that convert industrial emissions into sustainable chemicals with unprecedented energy and cost efficiency, starting with ethylene, the world's most used petrochemical. By displacing fossil fuels for the production of key chemicals, Dioxycle has the potential to ultimately reduce over 800 million tons of CO2 per year, representing ~2% of the world's emissions. Our team is innovating across chemical, mechanical and system engineering to turn carbon transformation into an economically feasible, industrial reality by developing a completely novel technological approach. Having completed our medium-scale Proof-of-Concept, we are now working towards our first-of-its-kind industrial-scale electrolyzer and are assembling key partnerships for future commercial roll-out. We are supported by world-class funders including Lowercarbon Capital, Breakthrough Energy Ventures and Gigascale Capital and have raised $26M to date. We operate from two centers in Paris and California (so whether you are passionate about outdoors or good food/art scenes, we have a location for you to join!) Your Mission Dioxycle is seeking a dedicated and passionate Data Lead to join our team and play a crucial role in supporting our mission of abating CO2 emissions by turning them into products we use every day. As our Data Lead, you will take responsibilities on the full data stack, including data collection, transformation, the development of data visualization tools and the testing of ML models. For this, you will be working closely with a software developer and another member of the Systems team, with daily interactions with the wider chemistry & engineering R&D team. In this capacity, your responsibilities will center around: - Data engineering: build a state-of the art pipeline to store, access and process the experimental and production data generated by our electrolyzers; - Data analysis & data science: develop data visualization tools to support the R&D team; develop statistical and ML models to extract correlations; implement a technology watch on the usage of AI; - Software engineering: collaborate with our software development team for code reviews and discussion about best development practices. We seek a Data Lead who is dedicated to advancing our mission and possesses the skills outlined below. Candidates with a minimum of five years of relevant experience are encouraged to apply.  Abilities and expertise we are looking for  Highly collaborative, problem solving oriented; Background in maths, physics or chemistry (MsC, PhD or other); Data science expertise: ML, time series analysis and image processing; Data engineering expertise: SQL, python; Full stack web develment experience with Python and React would be a plus, but not a strict requirement Able to work onsite in Paris (Saint-Ouen) full-time (occasional work from home)  Mindset we are looking for  Commitment to the mission and ambition Innovative spirit Determination to deliver on the mission you own, whatever it takes Irreproachable work ethic Anticipation capabilities Radical open-mindedness: no ego. Ideas first  What we have to offer  Impact: We are building a product unique in the world with the potential to radically transform a century-old chemical process to slash emissions at the gigaton scale. Unique journey: We are an early-stage company with a world-class team, offering second-to-none career growth opportunities. People-first: We are no-ego doers focused on self-improving while helping each other grow. International team: We are a uniquely international team with >10 nationalities Top of market compensation packages including Competitive salary, generous Employee Stock Ownership plans, 401(k) Health Insurance: Medical, dental, and vision coverage Ergonomic work stations & state-of-the-art equipment Emphasis on training opportunities Fun: We constantly strive to cultivate a great work atmosphere and organize regular team events.

description_cie: RÃ©duire lâ€™impact environnemental du shipping. AYRO catalyse la dÃ©carbonation du transport maritime en dÃ©veloppant et fournissant un systÃ¨me propulsif Ã©olien performant nommÃ© OceanwingsÂ®.
description_job: About AYRO AYRO is a French, Deep Tech startup, with the global ambition of enabling the decarbonization of the maritime shipping industry worldwide. We design, build and sell the OceanWings, enabling commercial vessels to reduce their fuel consumption and therefore their CO2 emissions by up to 50% using the power of the wind. By 2050, shipping could represent 15% of all CO2 emissions: the emission reduction potential of our solution could be measured in Gigatons of CO2 in the next 5-10 years. Our OceanWings 363 have recently been installed on the CanopÃ©e shipping vessel who will transport the Ariane 6 rocket from Europe to Kourou in French Guyana and many other large projects are in the works. Job Overview As part of the performance team in AYRO's Paris office, you will be involved in the performance assessment of Oceanwings and the vessels equipped with them. The aim is to holistically address the impact of a wind propulsion system on a vessel in order to draw conclusions on its economic, ecological and regulatory relevance within a specific operational profile. The evaluation of the measured performance of the Oceanwings will provide input for future optimization of the Oceanwings. If you have a masterâ€™s degree in naval engineering, you have experience in data analysis, you are passionate about technological challenges, you are interested in the maritime sector and are sensitive to environmental issues, this job is for you. Main Missions In cooperation with the Performance Manager and the performance engineers, your missions will include: Â· Development of analysis tools: Continue the development, mostly in Python, of algorithms for processing, analyzing and displaying data collected on board vessels equipped with Oceanwings. Â· Production of performance reports of navigations for internal and client use. Â· Improvement of predictions: Check the predictions against the at-sea measurements and collaborate with simulation and modeling engineers to fine-tune the models for optimal alignment with the measured data  Â· Master degree in Naval (or aeronautical) Engineering, with experience in data analysis. Â· You have a first professional experience in data analysis (1-5 years) Â· Strong skills in applied mathematics. Â· Proficiency in python Â· You have a creative mind, you are autonomous, reliable, curious & dynamic. Very good level of English, and ideally of French

description_cie: Providing data science capabilities to help NGOs and international cooperation agencies build their programmes and measure their impact
description_job: Masae Analytics is a fast-growing start-up company providing consulting services based on data analytics. We develop innovative methodologies leveraging a wide array of technologies such as remote sensing and satellite imagery processing, geo-mapping, web development, econometrics, machine learning, big data processing, etc. We apply those skills to topics as diverse as climate change monitoring, post-conflict damage assessments, telecom and energy planning, geopolitics, foreign-influence and disinformation detection, geo-marketing, digital divide and mobile financial services. Together with our sister company Altai Consulting (www.altaiconsulting.com), Masae Analytics works for both public sector (the United Nations, the World Bank, the GSMA, etc.) and corporate actors (retailers, mobile network operators**, satellite operators,**etc.) in Europe and (mainly) in emerging markets, particularly Africa and the Middle-East. We are currently expanding our team of Data Scientists, and are looking for candidates eager to meet challenges and discover new culture and environments. For further information please visit our website: www.masae-analytics.com Job description Key aspects of the Data Scientist mission will be to: - Understand clientsâ€™ needs - Conduct statistical and business analytics - Design and implement new approaches to answer clientsâ€™ needs - Produce analytical reports and presentations - Contribute to the development and optimization of Masaeâ€™s tools and processes Salary: 1400â‚¬/month  General requirements: - Curiosity, flexibility, attention to details and strong work ethics - Sensitivity to data security and confidentiality - Eagerness to travel and to discover new cultures & environments - Interest in international development/cooperation issues Technical requirements: - Knowledge of Python Data Science environments (IPython/Jupyter Notebook, Pandas, Numpy, Scikit-learn, etc.) Nice to have: - Knowledge of SQL and of its open-source implementations (Postgres, MySQL, SQLite) - Knowledge of geographic analysis tools (PostGIS, QGIS) and of its Python libraries - Knowledge of Natural Language Processing tools and Python libraries - Knowledge of NoSQL (MongoDB) or Hadoop / Apache Spark or tools like Splunk or Elastic Search - Comfortable with big data manipulation and parallel computing - Knowledge of Unix shell (OS X / Linux) - Basic knowledge of web languages/frameworks (JavaScript, HTML, CSS, etc., Python web frameworks like Django, Flask)

description_cie: ACCâ€™s mission is to accelerate the transition to sustainable and affordable mobility for all, significantly reducing greenhouse gas emissions through producing batteries in Europe.
description_job: Join us and be a pioneer for a green transport revolution.Automotive Cells Company (ACC) is one of Europeâ€™s newest and most exciting high-tech companies.Â Backed byÂ Saft-Total, Stellantis and Mercedes-Benz,Â ACC is set toÂ power the futureÂ of the automotive industryÂ by innovating in battery technology.Â We aim to produce sustainable, affordable, high-capacity, longer-life batteries as aÂ cleanerÂ alternative to current energy sources. We have created an R&DÂ centerÂ and new state-of-the art facilityÂ in Nouvelle Aquitaine, France, and we are building gigafactories in Germany and Italy, in addition to the one already built in Hauts de France.We need a range ofÂ skilled and agile peopleÂ to bring our vision to life,Â especially in the areas ofÂ industrialization, mechanical design, testing/prototyping and any other function of a new-bornÂ company. If youâ€™re looking to take your career further than you imagined, if youâ€™re passionateÂ about creating cleaner transport, weâ€™d like to hear from you.Our core Values are : Pioneering Spirit, Fast & Agile, Excellence, Greener & Cleaner !We are also very proud of our 2022 CSR Report : https://www.acc-emotion.com/stories/accs-2022-corporate-sustainability-reportAccelerating sustainable mobility for all.Overall job definition :The HR Data Analyst will play a pivotal role in collecting, analyzing, and interpreting HR data to drive strategic decision-making and support HR initiatives. Use data analysis to improve HR practices, enhance employee experiences, and contribute to the organization's overall success.Main missions :Data Governance :Â· Gather, organize, and maintain HR data from various sources to ensure accuracy and completeness.Â· Establish robust data management practices and procedures.Â· Ensure HR data handling complies with data protection regulations.Â· Safeguard the confidentiality and security of sensitive HR data.Â· Ensure Bridge with data department.Data Analytics :Â· Analyze HR data to extract valuable insights and trends.Â· Generate regular and ad-hoc reports, visualizations, and dashboards to aid decision-making.Â· Develop and monitor key HR metrics and KPIs to assess the effectiveness of HR processes.Â· Contribute to the development of data-driven strategies to improve HR outcomes.Â· Provide actionable insights derived from data analysis to support HR initiatives.Â· Collaborate with HR teams to make data-informed decisions that enhance HRProcess Improvement:Â· Identify opportunities to streamline HR data processes and enhance data quality.Â· Collaborate with HR teams to implement process improvements, automation and increase efficiency.Â· Provide training and support to HR staff on data-related tools and best practices.Â· Share knowledge and insights with colleagues to promote a data-driven HR culture. Knowledge :- Data Analysis Skills- HR Knowledge- Data Management- Project Management- Visualization and Reporting/Experience :At least 2 years (apprentices included)Qualifications:Master of Science in Human Resource Management. Master of Science in Data Science or Analytics. Master of Science in Industrial-Organizational Psychology. French, EnglishKey behaviours :- Critical Thinking - Communication Skills- Attention to Detail- Continuous Learning- Teamwork agility and proactive.Some extra skills which make the difference :PowerBI, SAP SuccessFactors, Experience in IndustryWhy join us?Our Advantages and Perks: new premises, parking spaces reserved for carpoolers, possibility of recharging your electric car on reserved spaces in our parking lot.Other perks and advantages include : Company restaurant, meal and also vegetables/fruits baskets delivery service. Janitorial services, telecommuting, complementary retirement plan (subject to a salary threshold), additionnal & seniority leaves, well-being workshops, osteopathy sessions.You will also benefit from access to our Sports & Culture association, conferences, and also sports, holidays and culture subsidy.https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NbXdlWjWhX8https://www.acc-emotion.com/fr/facilities/bruges-bordeauxOur process usually involves 3 interviews: 2 technical and one HR.

description_cie: Dioxycle develops breakthrough technology to produce everyday fuels and chemicals from CO2 shifting from a fossil-based economy to a circular CO2-based economy.
description_job: About Dioxycle Dioxycle is pioneering breakthrough carbon utilization technologies that convert industrial emissions into sustainable chemicals with unprecedented energy and cost efficiency, starting with ethylene, the world's most used petrochemical. By displacing fossil fuels for the production of key chemicals, Dioxycle has the potential to ultimately reduce over 800 million tons of CO2 per year, representing ~2% of the world's emissions. Our team is innovating across chemical, mechanical and system engineering to turn carbon transformation into an economically feasible, industrial reality by developing a completely novel technological approach. Having completed our medium-scale Proof-of-Concept, we are now working towards our first-of-its-kind industrial-scale electrolyzer and are assembling key partnerships for future commercial roll-out. We are supported by world-class funders including Lowercarbon Capital, Breakthrough Energy Ventures and Gigascale Capital and have raised $26M to date. We operate from two centers in Paris and California (so whether you are passionate about outdoors or good food/art scenes, we have a location for you to join!) Your Mission Dioxycle is seeking a dedicated and passionate Data Lead to join our team and play a crucial role in supporting our mission of abating CO2 emissions by turning them into products we use every day. As our Data Lead, you will take responsibilities on the full data stack, including data collection, transformation, the development of data visualization tools and the testing of ML models. For this, you will be working closely with a software developer and another member of the Systems team, with daily interactions with the wider chemistry & engineering R&D team. In this capacity, your responsibilities will center around: - Data engineering: build a state-of the art pipeline to store, access and process the experimental and production data generated by our electrolyzers; - Data analysis & data science: develop data visualization tools to support the R&D team; develop statistical and ML models to extract correlations; implement a technology watch on the usage of AI; - Software engineering: collaborate with our software development team for code reviews and discussion about best development practices. We seek a Data Lead who is dedicated to advancing our mission and possesses the skills outlined below. Candidates with a minimum of five years of relevant experience are encouraged to apply.  Abilities and expertise we are looking for  Highly collaborative, problem solving oriented; Background in maths, physics or chemistry (MsC, PhD or other); Data science expertise: ML, time series analysis and image processing; Data engineering expertise: SQL, python; Full stack web develment experience with Python and React would be a plus, but not a strict requirement Able to work onsite in Paris (Saint-Ouen) full-time (occasional work from home)  Mindset we are looking for  Commitment to the mission and ambition Innovative spirit Determination to deliver on the mission you own, whatever it takes Irreproachable work ethic Anticipation capabilities Radical open-mindedness: no ego. Ideas first  What we have to offer  Impact: We are building a product unique in the world with the potential to radically transform a century-old chemical process to slash emissions at the gigaton scale. Unique journey: We are an early-stage company with a world-class team, offering second-to-none career growth opportunities. People-first: We are no-ego doers focused on self-improving while helping each other grow. International team: We are a uniquely international team with >10 nationalities Top of market compensation packages including Competitive salary, generous Employee Stock Ownership plans, 401(k) Health Insurance: Medical, dental, and vision coverage Ergonomic work stations & state-of-the-art equipment Emphasis on training opportunities Fun: We constantly strive to cultivate a great work atmosphere and organize regular team events.

description_cie: RÃ©duire lâ€™impact environnemental du shipping. AYRO catalyse la dÃ©carbonation du transport maritime en dÃ©veloppant et fournissant un systÃ¨me propulsif Ã©olien performant nommÃ© OceanwingsÂ®.
description_job: About AYRO AYRO is a French, Deep Tech startup, with the global ambition of enabling the decarbonization of the maritime shipping industry worldwide. We design, build and sell the OceanWings, enabling commercial vessels to reduce their fuel consumption and therefore their CO2 emissions by up to 50% using the power of the wind. By 2050, shipping could represent 15% of all CO2 emissions: the emission reduction potential of our solution could be measured in Gigatons of CO2 in the next 5-10 years. Our OceanWings 363 have recently been installed on the CanopÃ©e shipping vessel who will transport the Ariane 6 rocket from Europe to Kourou in French Guyana and many other large projects are in the works. Job Overview As part of the performance team in AYRO's Paris office, you will be involved in the performance assessment of Oceanwings and the vessels equipped with them. The aim is to holistically address the impact of a wind propulsion system on a vessel in order to draw conclusions on its economic, ecological and regulatory relevance within a specific operational profile. The evaluation of the measured performance of the Oceanwings will provide input for future optimization of the Oceanwings. If you have a masterâ€™s degree in naval engineering, you have experience in data analysis, you are passionate about technological challenges, you are interested in the maritime sector and are sensitive to environmental issues, this job is for you. Â· Improvement of predictions: Check the predictions against the at-sea measurements and collaborate with simulation and modeling engineers to fine-tune the models for optimal alignment with the measured data  Â· Master degree in Naval (or aeronautical) Engineering, with experience in data analysis. Â· You have a first professional experience in data analysis (1-5 years) Â· Strong skills in applied mathematics. Â· Proficiency in python Â· You have a creative mind, you are autonomous, reliable, curious & dynamic. Very good level of English, and ideally of French
